```
  ...
  #endif /* __COMMON_DATA_H__ */
```

Using a static global variable makes this driver non-reentrant.
If two threads call ad5706r_spi_reg_read_multiple concurrently with different devices, they will corrupt each other's settings. Perhaps declare this struct and have it in the dev structure, so each instance has its own spi settings.

Error Handling.body: inconsisntent alignment, check raw file.
if the hardware write fails in `adgs6414d_update_err_config` then the value cached is wrong.
no error handling for most of the below functions
you need to have error paths in the while loop such that the cleanup procedure is reached.

an error check would be nice: 
```
  if not environment_path_files:
      print("Error: ENVIRONMENT_PATH_FILES environment variable not set")
      exit(1)
```

```
wget -P ./tools/scripts/ \
          https://raw.githubusercontent.com/...cloudsmith_helper.py && \
        python3 ./tools/scripts/build_projects.py .
``` 
chain it like this if we don't want to run build_projects.py if wget fails.

> the functions are not void.

True but the point of this patch is to avoid leaks. On no-OS there are multiple patterns for remove functions:
- the one with buggy leaks that returns early.
- the no error handling.
- the ret aggregation.

I'd go then for 3rd.

Constants/Magic Numbers.body: replace the magic numbers with suggestive macros (that you might already have defined).
can we get somehow these paths dynamically instead of hardcoded values? or at least define some variables with `?=` to have some defaults?
magic numbers. consider using named constants or adding a comment explaining the logic.
i think this will be an undefined behavior if xrmsos_int > measured_sq
what is 16? please check the entire code and avoid using magic numbers.
magic number. please add suggestive macro.
Avoid magic numbers. Replace them with `enum` values for `case` labels.

Type Safety.body: will work at some point :) can drop this for now.
do you intend to add iio_support? otherwise remove.
is this print needed? or only for debug purposes?

> I think you need to update also this.

Nope. 
The output always fits in uint8_t:
t <= 64: temp is max 64
t <= 316: temp is max 127
t < 1328: temp is max 191 (0xBF)
This is intentional - it's a wrapper script that replaces the original xsdb binary, so it should not have an extension.

I think casting &prod_id[1] to uint16_t* causes buffer overflow (writes 2 bytes starting at index 1 of a 2-byte array). Perhaps you should use separate uint16_t variables instead and combine them explicitly.

`data` is still `uint8_t` so I don't think this will work.

consider doing ` data = no_os_bin2bcd(ts.year - (century ? 2100 : 2000));`

this should be `builds.json`. Remove the underscore `_` from the filename. Otherwise it won't be parsed by the CI. Unless you have the same issue as here: https://github.com/analogdevicesinc/no-OS/commit/df789f67eab6ff4be614dc8a5f6ae31a2d1aaf9d
